title: How to Grow Forced Rhubarb

steps.headline: Grow rhubarb.
steps.description: If wished, grow rhubarb from seed. Before forcing the rhubarb, it must be established, for at least 2-3 years.

steps.headline: Find a rhubarb forcer at your local garden center.
steps.description: This is a covering that is placed over the plant to create darkness. Alternatively, simply purchase or find a clean, tall bucket and to place over the rhubarb. Even a clean old bin will work.

steps.headline: Clear the area around the rhubarb crown.
steps.description: Make sure it is clear of debris, other plants, etc. so that you can place down the forcer object.

steps.headline: Place over the rhubarb crown.
steps.description: Plug any holes that might let in light.

steps.headline: Continue to keep watered and fertilized as usual.
Collect the lovely pale pink stems when they're ready.
steps.description: They are ready when they're about 20–30 centimeter (7.9–11.8 in) in length, about eight weeks later.

text: Grow rhubarb. If wished, grow rhubarb from seed. Before forcing the rhubarb, it must be established, for at least 2-3 years. Find a rhubarb forcer at your local garden center. This is a covering that is placed over the plant to create darkness. Alternatively, simply purchase or find a clean, tall bucket and to place over the rhubarb. Even a clean old bin will work. Clear the area around the rhubarb crown. Make sure it is clear of debris, other plants, etc. so that you can place down the forcer object. Place over the rhubarb crown. Plug any holes that might let in light. Continue to keep watered and fertilized as usual.  Collect the lovely pale pink stems when they're ready. They are ready when they're about 20–30 centimeter (7.9–11.8 in) in length, about eight weeks later.
